intro: Aethionema balansae, commonly known as the Balansae Campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species that typically reaches heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a delicate ornamental value. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Aethionema balansae thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy environments.
